info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 9:24PM MDT until July 09 at 12:30AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING FOR THE HERMITS PEAK-CALF CANYON BURN SCAR REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM MDT SATURDAY FOR SOUTHWESTERN MORA AND NORTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES... At 924 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain over the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Between 0.25 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Gascon to Rociada and downstream along the Rito San Jose. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon Burn Scar. Drainages feeding into the Rito San Jose and Manuelitas Creek will be first impacted. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Las Vegas, El Porvenir, Sapello, Tierra Monte, Montezuma, Storrie Lake State Park, Ledoux, Gascon, Morphy Lake State Park, San Ignacio in Guadalupe County, Manuelitas, Gallinas, Rociada and South Carmen. This includes the following low water crossings... West Las Vegas High School, Mills Bridge and Valencia Street. This includes the following recreation areas... E.V. Long Campground, El Porvenir Campground, Las Vegas National Wildlife Refuge, Morphy Lake State Park and Storrie Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 6. State Road 276 between Mile Markers 0 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 1 and 20. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 344 and 352. State Road 65 between Mile Markers 1 and 14. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 1 and 8. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 9. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermit`s Peak/Calf Canyon burn area. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
